meanings.definition: To throw or toss something in a casual or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: He chucked the ball to his friend.
meanings.sent2: She chucked the paper into the recycling bin.
meanings.sent3: The monkey chucked the banana peel at the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: The wind chucked the leaves around the yard.
meanings.sent5: The child chucked the toy across the room with glee.

meanings.definition: To discard or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: They chucked the old clothes in the donation bin.
meanings.sent2: He chucked the broken mug into the trash.
meanings.sent3: She chucked the expired food from the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The gardener chucked the wilted flowers from the vase.
meanings.sent5: The teacher chucked the incorrect papers into the recycling bin.

meanings.definition: To give up or abandon something.
meanings.sent1: He chucked his unhealthy habits for a better lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: She chucked her dreams of becoming an artist.
meanings.sent3: The explorer chucked the idea of climbing the mountain.
meanings.sent4: The student chucked the difficult math problem and moved on.
meanings.sent5: The athlete chucked the old training routine for a new one.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden movement or change in direction.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel chucked to the side to avoid the car.
meanings.sent2: She chucked forward to catch the falling book.
meanings.sent3: He chucked back in surprise at the loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The bird chucked upwards to reach the higher branch.
meanings.sent5: The cat chucked sideways to pounce on the toy mouse.
